page.title: 082257 THE BLACK BURN
page.content:
TOPOGRAPHY:-{The valley of the Black {Burn is very steep and marshy.There {is a large number of reeds growing by {the stream.The water is very dark {brown owing to the peaty nature of the {soil,hence the name Black Burn.The {ground rises from 240m to nearly 260m {within this 1km square.There are few {trees in the area except for a line of {mixed trees near the West Linton road.
LAND USE:- {Most of this area is part of {HALLS FARM and is used for grazing {Blackfaced sheep and beef cattle.
WILDLIFE:- {Rabbits are plentiful and there is {also a number of hares and roe deer. {In bird life there are crows,sparrows, {blue-tits,grouse and many others.
